faqSection.title: Common Questions About Securing a Shop For Rent in Sushant Lok Phase 2 Gurgaon
faqSection.description: We understand that leasing a commercial property involves numerous considerations. Our FAQ section addresses the most frequent inquiries from prospective tenants looking for a shop for rent in Sushant Lok Phase 2 covering legal financial and operational aspects.

faqs.question: What is the typical lease duration for a commercial shop rental in Sushant Lok Phase 2
faqs.answer: The standard commercial lease duration in this area of Gurgaon is usually three to five years with an escalation clause for rent revision typically applied after the first three years. Landlords generally prefer longer leases for stability but shorter terms might be negotiable for smaller spaces or specific business types. Always clarify the lock-in period which specifies the minimum time you must stay to avoid penalty. Reviewing the renewal options and the notice period is also crucial before finalising your shop for rent agreement.

faqs.question: How is the common area maintenance CAM calculated for retail shops here
faqs.answer: Common Area Maintenance CAM charges cover the costs associated with maintaining shared facilities such as security cleaning lighting elevators and external building upkeep. CAM is usually charged as a separate fee either calculated per square foot of the leased area or as a fixed monthly amount. In Sushant Lok Phase 2 premium complexes typically have higher CAM charges due to advanced amenities. Ensure you receive a detailed breakdown of what is included in the CAM before signing the rental contract for your shop.

faqs.question: Are there specific legal requirements for registering a rental shop agreement in Gurgaon
faqs.answer: Yes all commercial lease agreements exceeding 11 months must be compulsorily registered with the Sub-Registrarâ€™s office in Gurgaon. This ensures the agreement is legally enforceable and protects both the tenant and the landlord. The cost of registration including stamp duty and registration fees is typically borne by both parties as per mutual agreement often split 50/50. Our team can assist you with the proper documentation and registration process for your shop for rent.

faqs.question: What are the average security deposit requirements for commercial shops in Sushant Lok Phase 2
faqs.answer: The security deposit for commercial rentals in prime Gurgaon locations like Sushant Lok Phase 2 usually ranges from three to six months worth of the stated rent. This deposit is refundable upon the termination of the lease provided there is no damage to the property beyond normal wear and tear and all dues are cleared. Negotiating the security deposit amount is sometimes possible especially for long-term leases or anchor tenants.

faqs.question: Can I renovate or modify the interior of the rental shop space
faqs.answer: Interior modifications are generally permitted but usually require written consent from the landlord and must adhere to all local building codes and complex regulations. Extensive structural changes are often prohibited. It is essential to clearly outline the scope of renovations in the lease agreement specifically addressing fixtures fittings and whether the space must be restored to its original condition upon lease expiration.

faqs.question: What are the best sizes for setting up a coffee shop or cafe in this area
faqs.answer: A successful coffee shop or cafe typically requires a space ranging from 500 square feet to 1200 square feet depending on the required seating capacity and whether it includes an independent kitchen setup. High street locations favour slightly larger spaces for visibility while internal market areas might suit smaller boutique cafes. Ensure the shop for rent has adequate provisions for water gas and necessary ventilation systems crucial for F&B operations.

faqs.question: Is parking easily available for customers visiting the commercial shops
faqs.answer: Most modern commercial complexes and planned markets in Sushant Lok Phase 2 offer dedicated basement or ground-level parking for customers and tenants. However shops located on older high streets may rely on street parking which can be limited during peak hours. Always verify the dedicated parking allocation or proximity to public parking when selecting your shop for rent to ensure convenience for your clientele.

faqs.question: How quickly can I occupy a shop after finalising the rental agreement
faqs.answer: The occupancy timeline depends primarily on the time taken for legal documentation registration and the existing condition of the shop. If the shop is already 'warm shell' and documentation is prompt you could take possession within 15 to 30 days. If extensive fit-outs are required or if the shop is 'bare shell' the process will take longer usually requiring a minimum of two months.

faqs.question: What utilities are typically included in the rent or charged separately
faqs.answer: Generally the rent covers only the use of the space itself. Utility costs such as electricity water internet and often the maintenance of individual AC units are charged separately and paid directly by the tenant. Some complexes may bill electricity through a sub-meter provided by the landlord. Always confirm the exact arrangement for metering and billing before leasing a shop for rent.

faqs.question: Are there restrictions on the type of business that can operate in a rental shop here
faqs.answer: While Sushant Lok Phase 2 is commercially diverse certain complexes or specific market areas might have restrictions imposed by the Resident Welfare Association RWA or the developer. For instance heavy manufacturing or businesses generating excessive noise or fumes might be restricted. Always confirm that your intended business activity aligns with the permitted use clause in the lease for your shop for rent.
